DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate safety efficacy Phenazopyridine Hydrochloride Tablets , USP 200 mg short term analgesic treatment primary symptom pain burn passing urine associate uncomplicated urinary tract infection ( uUTI )
DOC.brief_title: Evaluate Safety Efficacy Phenazopyridine Hydrochloride Tablets , USP 200 mg v . Placebo
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis uncomplicated urinary tract infection ( uUTI ) Must one follow uUTI diagnosis Cystitis Urethritis A Positive urine dipstick test show nitrate leukocyte esterase ( LE ) Negative pregnancy test ( applicable ) Must one follow symptom pain upon urination burn upon urination In addition , one follow symptom Not able empty bladder completely Pain discomfort low abdomen , pelvic area Frequent urge urinate Blood urine Any diagnosis urinary tract kidney disorder uUTI A diagnosis Pyelonephritis ( kidney infection low uUTI spread upper tract ) Women history prior use phenazopyridine hydrochloride Women take systemic antiinfectives within seven day study participation Women history G6PD deficiency hemolytic anemia Women know history anatomical genitourinary ( GU ) anomalies GU surgery within past 6 month Women child bear age consent pregnancy test Women lactate Chronic infection urinary tract require intravenous pyelogram ( IVP ) , ultrasound cystoscopy Subjects clinically significant abnormal result find screen physical examination , laboratory test , vital sign ECG . Subjects unable comprehend language inform consent self evaluation scale . Subjects serious acute illness ( e.g . pneumonia ) untreated unstable medical illness would likely interfere assessment uUTI Subjects receive investigational medication part drug trial 3 month prior baseline study visit Subjects history severe drug allergy hypersensitivity Subjects know sensitivity Phenazopyridine , Hyoscyamine , Butabarbital antibiotic . Employees investigator institution direct involvement trial trial direction investigator associate .
